channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Muscat close to deal to become Rangers head coach
item.description: Rangers are close to agreeing a deal to secure Shanghai Port's Kevin Muscat as their new head coach, but personal terms and other issues have still to be finalised.

item.title: No Maccabi Tel Aviv fans allowed at Villa match
item.description: Aston Villa confirm no away fans will be permitted to attend the Europa League match at Villa Park against Maccabi Tel Aviv in November.

item.title: 'Dark days behind us' - Pickford signs new Everton deal
item.description: England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford signs a new contract at Everton that will keep him at the club until the summer of 2029.

item.title: Premier League clubs divided over spending limit proposals
item.description: Premier League clubs are divided over whether to introduce a controversial new 'salary cap' prior to next month's vote on financial regulations, BBC Sport has been told.

item.title: 'I'm not in Dubai for money... I don't want my kids growing up in England'
item.description: About 75 fans watched Jonjo Shelvey's debut in the third tier of the United Arab Emirates - but he says he has not moved for money.

item.title: Sheff Wed set to be served winding-up petition
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday could "imminently" be served with a winding-up petition over £1m they owe to HMRC, reports BBC Radio Sheffield.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Aya and Addison from Jamie Johnson FC
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Aya and Addison from CBBC football drama Jamie Johnson FC with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Man Utd set fee for Fernandes - Friday gossip
item.description: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes interests Bayern Munich, Liverpool eye Nico Schlotterbeck and Nico Williams, while Barcelona weigh up move for Dusan Vlahovic

item.title: Why Man Utd's next four games could shape their season
item.description: As Manchester United search for back-to-back wins, BBC Sport looks at why their next four games could be key for Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Retiring Fishlock's best Wales goals
item.description: Look back at some of the best goals the retiring midfielder has scored for her country.

item.title: 'This is what 20 years of collecting shirts looks like'
item.description: Doug Bierton, co-founder of Classic Football Shirts, speaks to BBC Sport's Nesta McGregor about his favourite shirts.

item.title: Highlights: De Bruyne stars as Belgium dent Wales' World Cup hopes
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Wales lose 4-2 to Belgium in World Cup qualifying in Cardiff.

item.title: Woltemade scores as Germany beat Northern Ireland
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Newcastle United striker Nick Woltemade scores the only goal as Germany beat Northern Ireland in World Cup qualifying.

item.title: Shaky Scotland hold on for nervy win over Belarus
item.description: Watch the best of the action as goals from Che Adams and Scott McTominay earn Scotland a narrow World Cup qualifying win over Belarus.

item.title: Agyemang joins Premier League stars on Golden award shortlists
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang is nominated for Golden Girl, while nine Premier League players are named on the shortlist for the Golden Boy award.

item.title: Is the 'inverted' winger here to stay?
item.description: This season has seen the further rise of the inverted winger and the decline of the traditional wide-man in the Premier League - is it leading to a less exciting game?

item.title: 'Shout out to my ex' - why clubs are turning to former bosses
item.description: With three clubs bringing back old bosses this season already, BBC Sport looks at the teams and managers who have got back together.

item.title: Still no Salah but make room for Eze - FPL team of the week
item.description: Eberechi Eze and Enzo Fernandez are midfielders to target, writes Thomas Woods, yet there's still no room for Mohamed Salah in the FPL team of the week.

item.title: Weekly sports quiz: Which nation qualified for their first World Cup?
item.description: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

item.title: Why WSL clubs are signing up Japan's best talent
item.description: There are more Japanese players in the Women's Super League than ever before - what impact are they having?

item.title: What is the manager VAR card being trialled by Fifa?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at how the Football Video Support system works.

item.title: Real's Alexander-Arnold has chance of facing Liverpool
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold's rehab is going according to plan and there is a chance the Real Madrid right-back will be fit to face his old club Liverpool in November's Champions League tie.

item.title: Overseas La Liga game 'good for football' and 'reward' for TV fans
item.description: La Liga's decision to move the game between Villarreal and Barcelona to Miami is "good for football", says Spanish football federation president Rafael Louzan.

item.title: Chelsea's Thompson 'a real bright spark' but best 'still to come'
item.description: Chelsea forward Alyssa Thompson was a "bright spark" as she scored her first goal, and her best is "still to come".

item.title: Bristol City 'held takeover talks' with Alalshikh
item.description: Bristol City CEO Tom Rawcliffe confirms the club held talks with Saudi sports supremo Turki Alalshikh over investment.

item.title: Football, fashion & the rise of the replica shirt
item.description: How football shirts have evolved from one kit per club per season, with simple designs, to fashion statements.

item.title: Icon, trailblazer & Wales hero - Fishlock's seismic legacy
item.description: On the eve of her international retirement, a look at how Wales midfielder Jess Fishlock's seismic impact has gone beyond her remarkable on-pitch exploits.

item.title: Akins returns to action following jail term
item.description: Striker Lucas Akins plays his first game for Mansfield Town after returning to the club following his release from prison.

item.title: Ex-West Ham player Benrahma fined over dog attack
item.description: The footballer is fined £12,000 after his dogs attacked a golden retriever in 2023.

item.title: What does xG tell us about how Premier League teams have started the season?
item.description: The Premier League table is starting to take shape and while results are obviously what matter most, they don't tell the whole story.

item.title: How are World Cup favourites shaping up - and who will win?
item.description: Now England have booked their place at the 2026 World Cup attention turns to how they might fare in North America next summer - and how some of their rivals are looking.

item.title: Why haven't Premier League Boxing Day fixtures been announced?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look at when the Premier League Boxing Day fixtures will get announced.

item.title: Why Caicedo is pivotal for Chelsea - but are they over-reliant?
item.description: The 23-year-old midfielder has three goals this season, including his powerful strike against Liverpool, entering the debate as being among the best in the league.

item.title: 'With service, Hojlund is a 25-goals-a-year striker'
item.description: Peter Schmeichel criticises the decision-making at Manchester United that has allowed Rasmus Hojlund to follow Scott McTominay to Napoli.

item.title: Which teams have qualified for the World Cup and who is on the brink?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: The Australian with a masterplan to get Scotland back to World Cup
item.description: Scotland head coach Melissa Andreatta talks exclusively to BBC Scotland about management, motherhood and making the 2027 World Cup.

item.title: Top European clubs discuss using six substitutes
item.description: Europe's top clubs, including some Premier League sides, have held discussions about using six substitutes per game to ease the workload on players.

item.title: Glasgow stun Koge with two late goals to progress in Europa Cup
item.description: Glasgow City score twice in stoppage time to secure a dramatic 5-3 win, 6-5 on aggregate, over Koge and move into the inaugural Women's Europa Cup's last 16.

item.title: Think you know your football shirts? Take our quiz...
item.description: Play our retro football shirts quiz and put your knowledge to the test.

item.title: Man City come from behind to beat Liverpool
item.description: Iman Beney and Aoba Fujino score for Manchester City as they come from 1-0 down at triumph at Anfield to extend Liverpool's winless start to the WSL season.

item.title: Clarke 'really, really disappointed' by Scotland despite win
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke is pleased with victory but unhappy with his side's performance in their World Cup qualification win over Belarus.

item.title: Man Utd score four against Everton to maintain unbeaten start
item.description: Substitute Jess Park scored a late double to help Manchester United secure a 4-1 win over Everton, carrying on their unbeaten start.

item.title: 'Unbelievable strike' - Walsh wins it for Chelsea against Spurs
item.description: Keira Walsh's "unbelievable strike" breaks the deadlock in the second half for Chelsea against Tottenham.

item.title: Bellamy urges Wales to embrace Belgium challenge
item.description: Wales manager Craig Bellamy urges his players to "embrace" the game against Belgium as they target automatic qualification for next year’s World Cup.

item.title: Arsenal earn first win in five games against Brighton
item.description: Arsenal end their four-match-long losing streak as they beat Brighton 1-0 in the Women's Super League at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Arsenal lacked quality and composure - Williams
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Anita Asante analyse Arsenal's attacking quality during their 1-0 Women's Super League win over Brighton.

item.title: Kirby reflects on first England call-up and 'Mini Messi' nickname
item.description: Former England star Fran Kirby reflects on the moment she received her first England call-up while playing for Reading in WSL2, which led to her breakthrough and being nicknamed 'Mini Messi'.

item.title: Stunning Walsh strike extends Chelsea's unbeaten league run
item.description: Keira Walsh delivers an incredible strike to break Chelsea's deadlock against Tottenham to win 1-0 and maintain their unbeaten WSL run.

item.title: How McTominay became a 'brother of Naples'
item.description: Scotland midfielder Scott McTominay reflects on his brilliant first season at Napoli, where he wants to keep giving his "absolute best".

item.title: Northern Ireland outclass Slovakia in Belfast
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Northern Ireland beat Slovakia 2-0 in their World Cup qualifier at Windsor Park in Belfast.

item.title: Maresca gets one-game ban for Liverpool celebrations
item.description: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca is given a one-match touchline ban and £8,000 fine following his sending off in the last-gasp win against Liverpool.

item.title: 'Humour made me smile' - Tuchel enjoys fans' chants
item.description: Thomas Tuchel says England fans' chants "made him smile" as they respond to his previous criticism in full voice in Riga.

item.title: The players with points to prove as England reach World Cup
item.description: England have qualified for next summer's World Cup, but who are the players who must still prove they deserve a spot in Thomas Tuchel's squad?

item.title: Paratici returns to Spurs after 30-month Fifa ban
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur announce that Fabio Paratici will return to his role of sporting director two and a half years after he was banned by Fifa.

item.title: 'Biggest thing since independence' - Cape Verde celebrates World Cup spot
item.description: Cape Verdeans took to the streets to celebrate qualifying for the World Cup, with many hailing it the best day since gaining independence in 1975.

item.title: Who makes your England World Cup starting XI?
item.description: Who would you pick in your England XI for the 2026 World Cup?

item.title: 'Another celebrity boss? No, I've earned my chance'
item.description: Forest Green boss Robbie Savage insists he is no "celebrity manager" after guiding his new side to a dream start, including a spot in the FA Cup first round.

item.title: How have the big-name striker signings done so far in the Premier League?
item.description: Strikers dominated the summer transfer window and we have taken a look at how nine of them have done since their moves.

item.title: 'I thought it was a heart attack' - how collapse changed Kirby's life
item.description: Former Lioness Fran Kirby reflects on the health scare that sidelined her for 10 months and her journey back to the top of the game.

item.title: 'One of our best ever' - why Pickford is England's undisputed number one
item.description: BBC Sport looks in depth at the game of England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, with the help of former Three Lions shot-stoppers Paul Robinson and Rob Green, and his former Toffees team-mates Wayne Rooney and Theo Walcott.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What does squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean.

item.title: Why do Australia play in Asia and not Oceania?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Socceroos play in the Asian Football Confederation and the Asian Cup.

item.title: When is the FA Cup first round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains when the FA Cup first-round takes place and what the fixtures are.

item.title: What is '007' in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the tagline of '007' means and where the taunt came from.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: What would Rangers be getting in Muscat?
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the leading candidate to replace Russell Martin as Rangers head coach, but what type of boss is he?

item.title: Rohl drops out of Rangers head coach search
item.description: Former Sheffield Wednesday manager Danny Rohl drops out of the race to become Rangers' new head coach, with Under-19 coach Steven Smith taking charge for Saturday's game against Dundee United.

item.title: Dundee United claim 'turning point' despite continued losses
item.description: Dundee United say they have recorded their "strongest financial result in recent years" despite reporting a pre-tax loss of £636,000 for the year to the end of June.

item.title: 'I'm fully all in with Bayern' - Kane cools on Premier League return
item.description: Harry Kane says his interest in returning to the Premier League has cooled and he is willing to open talks with Bayern Munich over a new contract.

item.title: Uefa 'reluctantly' approves games played abroad
item.description: Uefa president Aleksander Ceferin says the decision to allow two European league matches to be played abroad is "exceptional" and insists it "will not set a precedent".

item.title: The younger Mbappe emerging from his brother's shadow
item.description: Being the brother of a football superstar is not easy. But Ethan Mbappe is aiming to emerge from the shadows and make a name for himself.

item.title: How Harry Kane-inspired tactic is undoing Barcelona
item.description: Barcelona have lost their latest two games and there is a Harry Kane-inspired tactical tweak that teams are using to disrupt their defence this season.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
